{{Infobox figure skater |name= Derrick Delmore |image= DerrickDelmore NH2007 1.JPG |caption= Delmore in 2007 |fullname= Derrick Delmore |altname= |country= |formercountry= |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1978|12|12}} |birth_place= [[Andrews AFB]], [[Maryland]] |hometown= |residence= |death_date= |death_place= |height= {{convert|172|cm|ft|abbr=on}} |partner= |formerpartner= [[Kelcie Lee]]
[[Crystal Kim]]
[[Alix Clymer]] |coach= |formercoach= [[Shirley Hughes]]
[[Peter Oppegard]] |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= [[Shirley Hughes]]
[[Jill Shipstad Thomas]] |skating club= Washington FSC |retired= |combined total= 157.84 |combined date= [[2004 Nebelhorn Trophy]] |SP score= 60.51 |SP date= [[2004 Nebelhorn Trophy]] |FS score= 102.52 |FS date= [[2005 Four Continents]] |medaltemplates= {{MedalSport | Men's [[Figure skating]]}} {{MedalCountry | [[United States of America|United States]] }} {{MedalCompetition|[[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Championships]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1998 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|1998 Saint John]]|[[1998 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|Men's singles]]}} }} '''Derrick Delmore''' (born December 12, 1978 in [[Andrews Air Force Base]], [[Maryland]]) is an African-American [[figure skater]]. He was the 1998 [[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Champion]] and the 1999 U.S. National Collegiate Champion. He attended [[Stanford University]] and double majored in psychology and communications. Delmore appeared as the male lead in a musical production of [[Cold As Ice]]{{Disambiguation needed|date=June 2011}} at the [[Gateway Playhouse]] in 2007 [http://gatewayplayhouse.com/2007/ColdAsIce/coldasice.html] in New York. Delmore competed as a pair skater early in his career on the novice level. In 2008, he retired from single skating to compete as a pair skater.{{cite news | url = http://www.usfsa.org/Story.asp?id=41009 | title= 1998 World Junior Champion Derrick Delmore Retires from Singles Skating | publisher = [[U.S. Figure Skating]] | date = March 11, 2008 | accessdate = June 25, 2009}} He teamed up with [[Kelcie Lee]]. They placed 5th at the junior level at their Sectional Championship and did not qualify for the [[2009 U.S. Figure Skating Championships]]. ==Competitive highlights== ===Pairs career=== (with Kelcie Lee) {| class="wikitable" |- !
